attributes.name: Button
attributes.description:
A component to render a simple button

{{uxs-button "BUTTON TEXT"}}

attributes.name: UXS Button
attributes.description:
A component to render a simple button

{{uxs-button "BUTTON TEXT"}}

arguments.name: disabled
arguments.description:
Set to true to disable this button.

This will activate it's disabled style and also prevent any actions from being fired.

arguments.name: inline
arguments.description: Set to true to enable the button to appear inline with other buttons or inline components. The button will use the inline-block display property.

arguments.name: loading
arguments.description:
Set to true if the button has already been pressed or should be disabled while another action takes place.

If the loadingText argument has been provided this will be displayed, defaults to "Loading…".

This will activate it's loading style and also prevent any actions from being fired..

arguments.name: mini
arguments.description:
Deprecated

Use the size="small" argument instead.

arguments.name: naked
arguments.description: Strip away any background styles and just display the buttons text.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description:
Add a custom name to your button, used for aria labels & test selectors.

By default this will be the same as the text argument unless you parse a different value.

arguments.name: selected
arguments.description:
Set's the button style to a selected state.

Can be used to toggle buttons or to infer an active state without disabling the buttons action.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description:
Set the size of the button. Default is medium.

UXS ships with the following stock sizes: giant, huge, large, medium, small, tiny.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .button--my-massive-size

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the button.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: secondary, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .button--my-custom-style

arguments.name: text
arguments.description:
The buttons text, this can be set as the first positional parameter.

It will also default to the components name.

attributes.name: UXS Button Link
attributes.description:
A component to render a link as a simple button

{{uxs-button-link "BUTTON TEXT" "photos.edit" photo}}

{{#uxs-button-link "photos.edit" photo}}
  BUTTON TEXT
{{/uxs-button-link}}

arguments.name: disabled
arguments.description:
Set to true to disable this button.

This will activate it's disabled style and also prevent any actions from being fired.

arguments.name: inline
arguments.description: Set to true to enable the button to appear inline with other buttons or inline components. The button will use the inline-block display property.

arguments.name: mini
arguments.description:
Deprecated

Use the size="small" argument instead.

arguments.name: naked
arguments.description: Strip away any background styles and just display the buttons text.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description:
Add a custom name to your button, used for aria labels & test selectors.

By default this will be the same as the text argument unless you parse a different value.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description:
Set the size of the button. Default is medium.

UXS ships with the following stock sizes: giant, huge, large, medium, small, tiny.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .button--my-massive-size

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the button.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: secondary, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .button--my-custom-style

arguments.name: text
arguments.description:
The buttons text, this can be set as the first positional parameter.

It will also default to the components name.

attributes.name: Content
attributes.description:
A typographic component to render content text

{{uxs-content "Lorem ipsum dolar"}}

{{#uxs-content}}Lorem ipsum dolar"{{/uxs-content}}

fields.name: base
fields.description: The BEM base name for this component: "content"

fields.name: testSelectorName
fields.description:
The test selector name defines the name of the [data-test-*] attribute binding
Default is "content"

fields.name: testSelectorValue
fields.description:
The base property is used as the value for test selectors.
_Default is the value of "name"

fields.name: layout
fields.description: The path to the handlbars template

arguments.name: align
arguments.description: The text align direction, "left", "center", "right" or "justified". Defaults to no alignment (inheret)

arguments.name: name
arguments.description:
The name of the component. This property also defaults to the value for test selectors.

The default is true, which ensures the test selector is added. If set to false the test selector is not rendered.

arguments.name: style
arguments.description: Adds a style modifier to the component. Standard options are "white", "light", "mid", "grey", "dark", "primary", "accent", "success", "warning" or "error". Defaults to no style (inheret) Default values will set the text color.

arguments.name: text*
arguments.description:
The text to be rendered inside this component
This can be passed in as the first positional parameter

{{uxs-text "Lorem ipsum dolar"}}

fields.name: base
fields.description: The BEM base name for this component: "uxs-heading"

fields.name: testSelectorName
fields.description:
The test selector name defines the name of the [data-test-*] attribute binding
Default is "text"

fields.name: testSelectorValue

The base property is used as the value for test selectors.
_Default is the value of "name"

fields.name: layout
fields.description: The path to the handlbars template

arguments.name: align
arguments.description: The text align direction, "left", "center", "right" or "justified". Defaults to no alignment (inheret)

arguments.name: name
arguments.description:
The name of the component. This property also defaults to the value for test selectors.

The default is true, which ensures the test selector is added. If set to false the test selector is not rendered.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description: Adds a style modifier to the component. Standard options are "white", "light", "mid", "grey", "dark", "primary", "accent", "success", "warning" or "error". Defaults to no style (inheret) Default values will set the text color.

arguments.name: style

arguments.name: weight
arguments.description: The text weight, "light", "normal", "bold" or "heavy". Defaults to null (inheret)

This can be passed in as the first positional parameter

attributes.name: Accessible
attributes.description: A mixin to add accesibility attributes to a component

fields.name: disabled
fields.description: Prevents the action from firing when true

fields.name: label
fields.description: Sets the an aria-label attribute

fields.name: propTypes
fields.description: Mixins Property Managment config

fields.name: role
fields.description: Sets the role attribute

attributes.name: Accessible
attributes.description: Add text-align arguments to a component

fields.name: align
fields.description: The text align direction, "left", "center", "right" or "justified". Defaults to no alignment (inheret)

attributes.name: Clickable
attributes.description: A mixin to add click support to a component.

fields.name: onClick
fields.description: The name of the action to fire on click

fields.name: propTypes
fields.description: Mixins Property Managment config

fields.name: role
fields.description: Add a role to the item for accessibility

attributes.name: Testable
attributes.description: A mixin to add ember test selectors to a component.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
The name property is used as the value for test selectors.
For example the foo-component would have the following selector:

{{foo-component name="bar"}}

[data-test-foo="bar"]

The default is true, which adds the attribute with no value.

If set to false the test selector is not rendered.

fields.name: base
fields.description:
The base property is used as the value for test selectors.
For example the foo-component would have the following selector:

{{foo-component base="foo"}}

[data-test-foo]

NOTE: The base property is also used by the bem-component mixin. If you need test selector base to differ you can set testSelectorName instead.
